00604|   state.current_permission = nil
00605| 
00606|   if old_permission and old_permission.callID then
00607|     local part_id = M._find_part_by_call_id(old_permission.callID)
00608|     if part_id then
00609|       M._rerender_part(part_id)
00610|       M._scroll_to_bottom()
00611|     end
00612|   end
00613| end
00614| 
00615| function M.on_file_edited(properties)
00616|   vim.cmd('checktime')
00617| end
00618| 
00619| ---Find part ID by call ID
00620| ---Searches messages in reverse order for efficiency
00621| ---Useful for finding a part for a permission
00622| ---@param call_id string Call ID to search for
00623| ---@return string? part_id Part ID if found, nil otherwise
00624| function M._find_part_by_call_id(call_id)
00625|   return M._message_map:get_part_id_by_call_id(call_id)
00626| end
00627| 
00628| ---Re-render existing part with current state
00629| ---Used for permission updates and other dynamic changes
00630| ---@param part_id string Part ID to re-render
00631| function M._rerender_part(part_id)
00632|   local cached = M._part_cache[part_id]
00633|   if not cached then
00634|     return
00635|   end
00636| 
00637|   local part, msg_wrapper, msg_idx, part_idx = M._message_map:get_part_by_id(part_id, state.messages)
00638| 
00639|   if not part or not msg_wrapper then
00640|     return
00641|   end
00642| 
00643|   local message_with_parts = vim.tbl_extend('force', msg_wrapper.info, { parts = msg_wrapper.parts })
00644|   local ok, formatted = pcall(formatter.format_part_single, part, {
00645|     msg_idx = msg_idx or 1,
00646|     part_idx = part_idx or 1,
00647|     role = msg_wrapper.info.role,
00648|     message = message_with_parts,
00649|   })
00650| 
00651|   if not ok then
00652|     vim.notify('format_part_single error: ' .. tostring(formatted), vim.log.levels.ERROR)
00653|     return
00654|   end
00655| 
00656|   M._replace_part_in_buffer(part_id, formatted)
00657| end
00658| 
00659| ---Get all actions available at a specific line
00660| ---@param line number 1-indexed line number
00661| ---@return table[] List of actions available at that line
00662| function M.get_actions_for_line(line)
00663|   local actions = {}
00664|   for _, action in ipairs(M._actions) do
00665|     if action.range and action.range.from <= line and action.range.to >= line then
00666|       table.insert(actions, action)
00667|     end
00668|   end
00669|   return actions
00670| end
00671| 
00672| ---Update stats from all messages in session
00673| ---@param messages OpencodeMessage[]
00674| function M._update_stats_from_messages(messages)
00675|   for _, msg in ipairs(messages) do
00676|     M._update_stats_from_message(msg)
00677|   end
00678| end
00679| 
00680| ---Update display stats from a single message
00681| ---@param message OpencodeMessage
00682| function M._update_stats_from_message(message)
00683|   if not state.current_model and message.info.providerID and message.info.providerID ~= '' then
00684|     state.current_model = message.info.providerID .. '/' .. message.info.modelID
00685|   end
00686| 
00687|   if message.info.tokens and message.info.tokens.input > 0 then
00688|     state.tokens_count = message.info.tokens.input
00689|       + message.info.tokens.output
00690|       + message.info.tokens.cache.read
00691|       + message.info.tokens.cache.write
00692|   end
00693| 
00694|   if message.info.cost and type(message.info.cost) == 'number' then
00695|     state.cost = message.info.cost
00696|   end
00697| end
00698| 
00699| return M

info.title: Adding blank line for display without affecting new content

metadata.diff:
Index: /Users/cam/Dev/neovim-dev/opencode.nvim/lua/opencode/ui/renderer.lua
===================================================================
--- /Users/cam/Dev/neovim-dev/opencode.nvim/lua/opencode/ui/renderer.lua
+++ /Users/cam/Dev/neovim-dev/opencode.nvim/lua/opencode/ui/renderer.lua
@@ -18,8 +18,9 @@
 M._part_cache = {}
 M._prev_line_count = 0
 M._message_map:reset()
 M._actions = {}
+M._has_trailing_line = false
 
 output_window.clear()
 
 state.messages = {}

input.oldString:
function M._write_formatted_data(formatted_data)
  local buf = state.windows.output_buf
  local start_line = output_window.get_buf_line_count()
  local new_lines = formatted_data.lines
  local extmarks = formatted_data.extmarks

  if #new_lines == 0 or not buf then
    return nil
  end

  -- Extract and store actions if present, adjusting to absolute positions
  if formatted_data.actions then
    for _, action in ipairs(formatted_data.actions) do
      action.display_line = action.display_line + start_line
      if action.range then
        action.range.from = action.range.from + start_line
        action.range.to = action.range.to + start_line
      end
      table.insert(M._actions, action)
    end
  end

  output_window.set_lines(new_lines, start_line)
  output_window.set_extmarks(extmarks, start_line)

  return {
    line_start = start_line,
    line_end = start_line + #new_lines - 1,
  }
end
input.newString:
function M._write_formatted_data(formatted_data)
  local buf = state.windows.output_buf
  local start_line = output_window.get_buf_line_count()
  
  -- Remove trailing blank line before adding new content
  if M._has_trailing_line and start_line > 0 then
    output_window.set_lines({}, start_line - 1, start_line)
    start_line = start_line - 1
    M._has_trailing_line = false
  end
  
  local new_lines = formatted_data.lines
  local extmarks = formatted_data.extmarks

  if #new_lines == 0 or not buf then
    return nil
  end

  -- Extract and store actions if present, adjusting to absolute positions
  if formatted_data.actions then
    for _, action in ipairs(formatted_data.actions) do
      action.display_line = action.display_line + start_line
      if action.range then
        action.range.from = action.range.from + start_line
        action.range.to = action.range.to + start_line
      end
      table.insert(M._actions, action)
    end
  end

  output_window.set_lines(new_lines, start_line)
  output_window.set_extmarks(extmarks, start_line)

  -- Add trailing blank line after writing
  local end_line = start_line + #new_lines
  output_window.set_lines({''}, end_line)
  M._has_trailing_line = true

  return {
    line_start = start_line,
    line_end = start_line + #new_lines - 1,
  }
end
